no_case.guidance: Examine the financial statement disclosures for clarity on the alternative basis of preparation used when not applying a going concern basis. For example, liquidation basis or other basis of accounting must be disclosed with sufficient details about the assumptions and methods applied.

items.question: Is there any indication that the entity is not regarded as a going concern?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?

decision_tree.question: Is there any indication that the entity is not regarded as a going concern?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and disclosures, specifically the notes related to the going concern assumption as per IAS 1. If the entity's directors are uncertain about its ability to continue as a going concern within the foreseeable future, this condition might be triggered. Common indicators include negative net asset positions, inability to meet debt obligations, or significant uncertainties regarding funding.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the notes accompanying the financial statements for a clear and specific disclosure. IAS 8.6K(c) requires the entity to explain why the going concern assumption is not applied. Ensure the disclosure highlights key reasons, such as financial difficulties, operational challenges, or external factors. Lack of sufficient detail is a common compliance issue.

items.question: Does the entity have material accounting policy information relevant to its financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose material accounting policy information?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have material accounting policy information relevant to its financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and assess whether there are significant accounting policies that influence its financial position, performance, or cash flows. Examples include revenue recognition, lease accounting, or inventory valuation. Refer to IAS 8.27A for details on what constitutes 'material' policy information.

yes_case.question: Is the material accounting policy information adequately disclosed in the financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Verify if the accounting policy information is disclosed in a way that is clear, prominent, and provides meaningful insights about how the entity has applied IFRS standards. Ensure that disclosures are aligned with the requirements of IAS 8.27A and are sufficient to allow users of financial statements to understand the choices made by the entity.

items.question: Has the entity changed an accounting policy that requires retrospective application under IAS 8.22?
items.original_question: If retrospective application is required, does the entity disclose the adjustment to the opening balance of each affected component of equity for the earliest prior period presented and the other comparative amounts for each prior period presented as if the entity had always applied the new accounting policy?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed an accounting policy that requires retrospective application under IAS 8.22?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements, including disclosures and accounting policies notes. Check for instances where the entity states it has changed an accounting policy. Refer to the requirements outlined in IAS 8.22 regarding changes due to new standards or voluntary changes. Ensure changes meet the conditions requiring retrospective application.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the adjustment to the opening balance of each affected component of equity for the earliest prior period presented?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the equity section of the statement of financial position for the earliest prior period presented. Verify that all adjustments due to the change in accounting policy are shown clearly and accurately. Refer to IAS 8.22 for specific disclosure requirements. Common pitfalls include missing disclosures for immaterial adjustments or confusion between adjustments resulting from errors versus policy changes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose other comparative amounts for each prior period presented as if the entity had always applied the new accounting policy?
yes_case.guidance: Review the financial statements and compare the reported amounts for prior periods against what they would have been if the new accounting policy had always been applied. Ensure the comparative amounts are restated consistently and the adjustment is clearly explained. Pay special attention to reconciliation statements provided by the entity.

items.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS accounting standard?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity prepare financial statements in accordance with IFRS?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the basis of preparation section of the financial statements or the accompanying notes to confirm the financial reporting framework used by the entity. Look for a statement explicitly mentioning IFRS compliance. Common pitfalls include misinterpretations of local GAAP convergence statements, which may not equate to IFRS compliance.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS accounting standard where applicable?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the accounting policies and related notes sections of the financial statements. Ensure any reference to IFRS standards includes the title of the relevant standard (e.g., IAS 8 'Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates, and Errors'). Omissions might be inadvertent but can impact compliance.

items.question: Has the entity changed any accounting policy during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with the transitional provisions and might have an effect on future periods, if applicable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed any accounting policy during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and note disclosures for any mention of changes in accounting policies. Common areas include changes due to new IFRS standards, management decisions, or corrections of prior period errors. Check IAS 8.14-15 for further clarifications on changes in accounting policies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the change in accounting policy?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the note disclosures in the financial statements related to accounting policies. The disclosure should include a description of the change, including the reason and nature of the adjustment. Refer to IAS 8.28(c) for disclosure requirements.

items.question: Has the entity changed any accounting policy during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with the transitional provisions and might have an effect on future periods, if applicable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed any accounting policy during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements and note disclosures for any mention of changes in accounting policies. Common areas include changes due to new IFRS standards, management decisions, or corrections of prior period errors. Check IAS 8.14-15 for further clarifications on changes in accounting policies.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the change in accounting policy?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the note disclosures in the financial statements related to accounting policies. The disclosure should include a description of the change, including the reason and nature of the adjustment. Refer to IAS 8.28(c) for disclosure requirements.

items.question: Has the entity applied a new or revised IFRS standard during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions, if applicable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied a new or revised IFRS standard during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies note in the financial statements and verify if any new or amended IFRS standards were adopted. Check for references to standards listed in the IASB's documentation for the reporting period. Ensure no standards are missed. Common pitfalls include overlooking standards with deferred application dates.

yes_case.question: Do the transitional provisions of the newly applied standard impact how the entity transitions its accounting policies?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to the specific IFRS standard in question. Transitional provisions can usually be found in the implementation section or appendices of the standard; look for requirements concerning retrospective or prospective application. Ensure to check for specific details on prior period adjustments.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the required transitional provisions as per IAS 8.28(d)?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IAS 8.28(d). Verify if the financial statements include detailed disclosures about the transitional provisions, including how the standard has been applied, any retrospective adjustments, prior period impact, and the effect on current and future periods.

items.question: Has the entity adopted a new accounting policy or made a change to an existing accounting policy during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions that might have an effect on future periods, if applicable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity adopted a new accounting policy or made a change to an existing accounting policy during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to the entity's accounting policy note in the financial statements and the disclosures provided. Check for any mention of adoption of new IFRS standards, amendments, or changes to previously applied accounting policies. Ensure to review IAS 8 paragraphs 19-31 regarding changes in accounting policies, estimates, and corrections of errors.

yes_case.question: Does the new or revised accounting policy include transitional provisions impacting future periods?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the details of the newly adopted or revised policy. Transitional provisions are usually provided under the specific IFRS standard that introduced the policy. Check IFRS standards issued during the reporting period and any amendments. Pay attention to IAS 8 paragraph 28(e) for detailed requirements.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the details of these transitional provisions that might affect future periods?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity’s financial statements, specifically the accounting policy note and disclosures regarding standards not yet adopted. The disclosure should include the nature of the transitional provisions, how they impact the financial statements, and their effect on future periods. Cross-check with IAS 8 paragraph 28(e).

items.question: Has the entity made an adjustment to a financial statement line item due to a change in accounting policy or correction of prior period errors?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the amount of the adjustment for each financial statement line item affected and the basic and diluted earnings per share for the current period and each prior period presented, to the extent practicable (if IAS 33 applies)?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made an adjustment to a financial statement line item due to a change in accounting policy or correction of prior period errors?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and management disclosures for any mention of adjustments made due to changes in accounting policy or corrections of prior period errors. These should align with the requirements under IAS 8. Ensure that such adjustments are explicitly stated and linked to financial statement line items. If no adjustments are reported, this question is not applicable.

yes_case.question: Does IAS 33 (Earnings Per Share) apply to the entity?
yes_case.guidance: Check if the entity is required to disclose earnings per share (EPS). IAS 33 applies to entities whose shares are publicly traded or that are in the process of issuing shares in a public market. Review the financial reporting framework and the notes for EPS information.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the amount of adjustment for each financial statement line item affected, as well as the basic and diluted EPS for both the current period and each prior period presented (to the extent practicable)?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosure details in the financial statements. The entity must provide information about the adjustment amounts explicitly for all relevant financial statement line items, including basic and diluted EPS. Focus on compliance with IAS 8.28(f) and ensure information is presented for all applicable periods.

items.question: Has the entity made an accounting policy change or correction of a prior-period error?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented, to the extent practicable?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made an accounting policy change or correction of a prior-period error?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and relevant sections in the general ledger. Look for disclosures or adjustments related to accounting policy changes or corrections of prior-period errors. Check IAS 8 paragraphs 14-27 to verify the treatment and identification of these adjustments.

yes_case.question: Does the accounting policy change or prior-period error affect periods before the ones presented in the current financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Analyze the nature of the accounting policy change or error correction. Refer to IAS 8.28 to determine if these adjustments impact periods prior to the comparative periods shown in the current financial statements. Common pitfalls include overlooking impacts on historical data.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented, to the extent practicable?
yes_case.guidance: Verify disclosures in the financial statements, particularly in the notes section where IAS 8 adjustments are typically presented. Ensure that the adjustment amount is disclosed, and where it is not practicable, confirm that the impracticability is properly justified as per IAS 8.28(g).

items.question: Has the entity made a change in accounting policy during the reporting period?
items.original_question: If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period or for periods before those presented, does the entity disclose the circumstances that led to that condition and describe how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made a change in accounting policy during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements or policy disclosures to identify any changes in accounting policy. Pay close attention to sections detailing changes due to new IFRS standards or voluntary changes improving financial reporting. Look out for any mention of 'change in accounting policy' or specific amendments to standards.

yes_case.question: Is the change in accounting policy required to be applied retrospectively under IAS 8?
yes_case.guidance: Check IAS 8 paragraphs 19–27 regarding retrospective application. Retrospective application is usually required unless impracticable. Ensure you review whether the accounting policy change relates to corrections of errors or initial adoption of a new or revised standard.

yes_case.question: Was retrospective application impracticable for one or more prior periods or for periods before those presented?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate whether the entity explicitly states that applying the new policy retrospectively was impracticable. Key indicators could include the lack of sufficient information to apply the change or issues with estimation that cannot meet IFRS requirements.

yes_case.question: Did the entity disclose the circumstances that led to retrospective application being impracticable and describe how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?
yes_case.guidance: Verify the disclosures in the financial statements (usually under the accounting policies or changes in accounting policies section). Look for specific details explaining why retrospective application was impracticable and a description of the point from which the policy change is effective and how it has been applied since.

items.question: Has the entity changed an accounting policy during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the nature of the change in accounting policy?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity changed an accounting policy during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and disclosures, particularly the notes section. Check for any mention of changes in accounting policies being described as required under IAS 8. Inspect prior-year comparatives and verify if changes are explicitly stated.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the change in accounting policy?
yes_case.guidance: Refer to IAS 8.29(a). The disclosure should describe what the change entails and why it was made (e.g., due to new IFRS standards or voluntary changes). Ensure the explanation is clear and detailed.

items.question: Did the entity make an adjustment to correct an error or change an accounting policy that affects periods before those presented?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented, to the extent practicable?

decision_tree.question: Did the entity make an adjustment to correct an error or change an accounting policy that affects periods before those presented?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting records and financial statements, particularly the disclosures for changes in accounting policies or corrections of prior-period errors as required by IAS 8. Look for retrospective adjustments and whether they impact periods prior to the ones currently presented. Common pitfalls include omitting adjustments related to earlier periods or misidentifying the adjustments that affect prior periods.

yes_case.question: Is it practicable to determine the amount of the adjustment for periods before those presented?
yes_case.guidance: Assess whether sufficient information or records exist to calculate the adjustment accurately. According to IAS 8, 'practicable' means all reasonable efforts have been made to obtain the necessary data without excessive cost or undue delay. If the data is unavailable or unreliable, disclosure of impracticability is required.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the amount of the adjustment relating to periods before those presented?
yes_case.guidance: Review disclosures in the financial statements, particularly in the notes. Ensure the adjustment amount is clearly stated and aligns with IAS 8.29(e). The disclosure should include a breakdown of the adjustments and how they relate to prior periods.

no_case.question: Has the entity disclosed that it was impracticable to determine the amount of the adjustment for periods before those presented?
no_case.guidance: Check the disclosures for a clear explanation of impracticability. IAS 8 requires entities to disclose why determining the adjustment amount was impracticable, including any constraints or challenges faced during this process.

items.question: Has the entity made a change in accounting policy that requires retrospective application?
items.original_question: If retrospective application is impracticable for a particular prior period or for periods before those presented, does the entity disclose the circumstances that led to that condition and describe how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity made a change in accounting policy that requires retrospective application?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accounting policies note to identify whether there is a change in accounting policy. Changes are typically due to new standards or revisions to existing standards. Ensure that the change impacts prior periods.

yes_case.question: Is retrospective application impracticable for a particular prior period or for periods before those presented?
yes_case.guidance: Check the entity's disclosures and working papers for evidence explaining why retrospective application is impracticable. Impracticability occurs when the entity cannot determine the prior period effects without undue effort or expense.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the circumstances that led to retrospective application being impracticable and describe how and from when the change in accounting policy has been applied?
yes_case.guidance: Review the disclosures in the financial statements, particularly the notes on accounting policies and changes. The entity must explain why retrospective application is impracticable, how the policy change has been applied, and from what date. Ensure this aligns with IAS 8.29(f).

items.question: Has a new IFRS been issued that is not yet effective and is applicable to the entity's financial reporting?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the fact that it did not apply a new IFRS that has been issued but is not yet effective?

decision_tree.question: Has a new IFRS been issued that is not yet effective and is applicable to the entity's financial reporting?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the latest IFRS publications and amendments issued by the IASB. Consult the entity's industry and financial reporting scope to confirm if any new standard or amendment applies to its activities. Be aware of standards that may seem industry-specific but still have broader implications.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed that it did not apply the new IFRS that is issued but not yet effective?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and specifically check for disclosures related to 'Standards and interpretations issued but not yet applied'. Ensure the disclosure explicitly states the non-application of the new IFRS and provides relevant details, such as the standard's title and effective date.

items.question: Has a new IFRS been issued but is not yet effective, and is it relevant to the entity's financial statements?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose known or reasonably estimable information relevant to assessing the possible impact that application of the new IFRS will have on the financial statements in the period of initial application?

decision_tree.question: Has a new IFRS been issued but is not yet effective, and is it relevant to the entity's financial statements?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the recent amendments, new IFRS, or revisions listed in the Notes to the Financial Statements or IFRS updates. Check if the new IFRS is applicable to the entity's accounting policies or transactions. Common pitfalls include ignoring standards applicable to industry-specific situations.

yes_case.question: Has the entity assessed the possible impact of the new IFRS on its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review internal documentation, IFRS implementation assessments, or meeting minutes of those charged with governance to verify the entity has considered the relevant impact. Ensure that the assessment covers notable areas such as measurement, presentation, and disclosure changes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose known or reasonably estimable information relevant to assessing the possible impact of the new IFRS in the Notes to the Financial Statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the Notes to the Financial Statements, particularly the section discussing upcoming changes in accounting policies. Confirm that the disclosure includes qualitative or quantitative details on how the new IFRS will affect the entity. Be cautious of vague or incomplete disclosures.

items.question: Has the entity adopted a new IFRS standard during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the title of the new IFRS?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity adopted a new IFRS standard during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the accounting policies note in the financial statements and check if there is any mention of adoption of a new IFRS standard during the reporting period. Look specifically for references to 'New Standards and Interpretations' or changes in accounting policies as required under IAS 8.30.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the title of the newly adopted IFRS standard in its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Examine the financial statements, particularly the accounting policies and disclosures section, and verify if the title of the newly adopted IFRS standard is clearly mentioned. This should appear as part of the entity's explanation of new or revised accounting policies (IAS 8.30(c)).

items.question: Is there an impending change in accounting policy at the entity?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the nature of the impending change or changes in accounting policy?

decision_tree.question: Is there an impending change in accounting policy at the entity?
decision_tree.guidance: Review recent amendments to IAS, IFRS, or local accounting standards applicable to the entity. Check Board minutes, regulatory filings, and accounting policy documentation for decisions or commitments to change accounting policies. Impending changes refer to those formally announced and expected to be implemented in future reporting periods.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of the impending change in accounting policy?
yes_case.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and sections dedicated to accounting policies. Check if the entity has explicitly explained the nature of the change (e.g., shift to a new measurement basis, adoption of a new standard) as required by IAS 8.30(d). Common pitfalls include vague language or incomplete information about the nature of the change.

items.question: Has the entity applied a new or amended IFRS standard during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the date by which application of the IFRS is required?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity applied a new or amended IFRS standard during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the financial statements and accounting policies note. Look for mentions of new IFRS standards or amendments effective during the reporting period. Check the IASB website or the entity's prior disclosures for updates on newly effective standards.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the date by which application of the IFRS standard is required?
yes_case.guidance: Check the financial statements, especially the accounting policies or notes discussing changes in standards. The disclosure should specify the effective date, as required under IAS 8.30(e). Commonly found errors include omission of the effective date or vague descriptions.

items.question: Has the entity identified a new IFRS that it plans to adopt for the first time?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose the date as at which it plans to adopt the IFRS initially?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity identified a new IFRS that it plans to adopt for the first time?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the notes to the financial statements and entity disclosures regarding standards issued but not yet effective. Check if the entity has identified any new IFRS that requires initial adoption in future reporting periods.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the date as at which it plans to adopt the IFRS initially?
yes_case.guidance: Check the disclosure section of the financial statements where information about new IFRS adoption is typically provided. Verify that the entity has clearly stated the intended adoption date for each IFRS it plans to adopt. Ensure the disclosed date is specific and matches the implementation timelines provided in IAS 8.30(f).

items.question: Has the entity initially applied a new or revised IFRS during the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity discuss the impact that initial application of the IFRS is expected to have on its financial statements or, if such impact is not known or reasonably estimable, state that fact?

decision_tree.question: Has the entity initially applied a new or revised IFRS during the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Check the entity's accounting policies note or disclosure section for mentions of newly applied IFRS during the reporting period. Refer specifically to IAS 8.28-30 for guidance on requirements for disclosing these changes.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose the expected impact of the initial application of the IFRS on its financial statements?
yes_case.guidance: Review the entity's disclosures for clear discussion of the expected financial impact. This may include changes to recognition, measurement, or presentation. If the impact is not known or reasonably estimable, ensure the entity states this explicitly (IAS 8.30(g)).

no_case.question: Does the entity explicitly state that the impact of the initial IFRS application is not known or reasonably estimable?
no_case.guidance: Verify whether the disclosures indicate that the expected impact cannot be determined or reasonably estimated. Ensure this statement is clear and unambiguous as per IAS 8.30(g).

items.question: Does the entity have significant assumptions about the future or major sources of estimation uncertainty as of the end of the reporting period?
items.original_question: Does the entity disclose information about the assumptions it makes about the future and other major sources of estimation uncertainty at the end of the reporting period that have a significant risk of resulting in a material adjustment to the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities within the next financial year?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have significant assumptions about the future or major sources of estimation uncertainty as of the end of the reporting period?
decision_tree.guidance: Review the entity's financial statements, particularly the notes to the accounts. Check for situations where estimates or assumptions are used to determine the carrying amounts of assets or liabilities, such as provisions, impairment reviews, or fair value measurements. Focus on areas with material impacts on the financial statements in the next financial year.

yes_case.question: Do these assumptions or sources of estimation uncertainty have a significant risk of resulting in a material adjustment to the carrying amounts of assets or liabilities within the next financial year?
yes_case.guidance: Evaluate the nature of the estimates disclosed. Consider areas like risk management, sensitivity analysis, and historical adjustments. Disclosures should clearly demonstrate the potential impact of these uncertainties.

yes_case.question: Does the entity disclose information about these significant assumptions and estimation uncertainties in line with IAS 8.31A?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for disclosures about assumptions and uncertainties as required by IAS 8.31A. Ensure that the information provided makes the potential impact understandable, including sensitivity analysis, methodologies used, and reasoning behind critical judgements.

items.question: Does the entity have assets or liabilities that fall under the scope of IAS 8.31A?
items.original_question: For the assets and liabilities in IAS 8.31A, does the entity disclose their nature?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have assets or liabilities that fall under the scope of IAS 8.31A?
decision_tree.guidance: Refer to IAS 8.31A and check whether the entity has made changes in accounting policies, estimates, or corrections of prior period errors that affect specific assets and liabilities. Review accounting records, supporting documents, and financial statement notes to confirm their existence.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the nature of these assets and liabilities affected by IAS 8.31A?
yes_case.guidance: Check the notes to the financial statements for disclosures about the assets and liabilities. Ensure the description aligns with IAS 8.31A requirements, detailing the nature of the assets and liabilities affected by changes in accounting policies, estimates, or prior period corrections.

items.question: Does the entity have assets or liabilities affected by retrospective application, retrospective restatement, or reclassification as defined in IAS 8.31A?
items.original_question: For the assets and liabilities in IAS 8.31A, does the entity disclose their carrying amount as at the end of the reporting period?

decision_tree.question: Does the entity have assets or liabilities affected by retrospective application, retrospective restatement, or reclassification as defined in IAS 8.31A?
decision_tree.guidance: Review IAS 8.31A and check whether the entity applied any retrospective adjustments (e.g., due to adoption of a new accounting policy, correction of errors, or reclassification of amounts). Look for these adjustments in the notes to the financial statements under 'Accounting Policies' and 'Changes in Accounting Policies'.

yes_case.question: Has the entity disclosed the carrying amounts of those assets and liabilities as at the end of the reporting period?
yes_case.guidance: Verify in the financial statement disclosures whether the entity has specified the carrying amounts of affected assets and liabilities after the adjustments. Refer to the notes section related to accounting changes or retrospectives for clarity. Common omissions include leaving certain adjusted items undisclosed or providing insufficient detail.
